instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC: What is SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC? SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC is a voltage that is created if SMC_BC_ACOK & PP3V42_G3H are both present that powers the chipset for the onewire circuit that allows the SMC to talk to the charger on the SYS_ONEWIRE line. This is necessary for the magsafe charger to have a light on it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light
threads.message:
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that has no power.
I don't get green light or fan spin.

I have  3.4V on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
3.4V on <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL>
3.3V on <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>
3.4V on <RESISTOR>R6929</RESISTOR>

<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>:
3.4 V <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>
18V Adapter sense
3.4V <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL>

Already  tried with new charging port.
Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light
threads.message:
"18V Adapter sense"
100% sure?
This means short to DCIN.

Try original 60/85W Magsafe 1 charger.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light
threads.message:
You're right. 
The charging port was shorted (but strangely i've alreay tried before with other port with the same result), and after replacing it, now i get green light but no power or fan spin. Going to check major rails now.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light
threads.message:
Hi,

I get this voltage measures:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> 12.5V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> 12.5
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 19.9
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> oscilates between 3 ~ 4
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> oscilates between 3.6 ~ 5 on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>. I think that the line is generated here, and this may be the problem. Am I correct?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light
threads.message:
Don't think you can get different readings in different test points of <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Also, once you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, no reason to check DCIN.
Avoid wasting time in the future.

Post <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> level; does it oscillate?
Check for short and voltage pulse at all big coils.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light
threads.message:
Hi,
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>  oscilates bettwen 0 and 3.4V

L7030 oscilates bettwen 12.5 and 13V
L7220 oscilates bettwen 0 and 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> seams to be shorted.  L7260 has 0.30 ohm and 0.0004V on diode mode.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no green light
threads.message: Catch the culprit; injection voltage should show it.
